Title: Eno highlights Akwa Ibom education projects at Lagos alumni gathering
Summary: Pastor Umo Eno restated his commitment to strengthening the education sector through the construction of model schools across the state . Speaking at a quarterly meeting of the Victory High School Old Students’ Association (1981) Eno highlights Akwa Ibom education projects at Lagos alumni gathering .

Title: Chinese envoy, FUNAAB to partner on food security, medicinal research
Summary: Consul General of the People’s Republic of China in Lagos, Ms. Yan Yuqing, paid a historic visit to the Federal University of Agriculture, Abeokuta (FUNAAB), with the aim of deepening bilateral cooperation in education . FUNAAB to partner on food security, medicinal research .

Title: Don urges govt action on funding, student loans, curriculum reform
Summary: A lecturer and the Director of Babcock Alumni and Connectivity, Dr. Jonathan Dangana, has charged the Federal Government to formulate a policy that will criminalise any parents who fail to send their wards to school in the country . Dr. Jangana was a lecturer at Babcock College in London .

Title: CBN harps on financial inclusion through SMEs to boost economy
Summary: CBN harps on financial inclusion through SMEs to boost economy . CBN organised public engagement to sensitise critical stakeholders and the public on how the Bank’s policies are being implemented .

Title: You should read at least one book every month. Here’s why
Summary: From boosting your brain to building empathy, reading regularly can transform the way you think, work, and connect with others . Here are some reasons why you should read at least one book every month .

Title: NDLEA arrests drug Kingpin after 3-year manhunt, intercepts N7.8bn opioids in Rivers
Summary: Operatives of the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) have arrested a notorious drug kingpin, Sunday Ibigide, in Delta State . The notorious kingpin went into hiding three years ago after a three-year manhunt .

Title: Police arrest serving officer, three civilians for alleged extortion, robbery in Benin
Summary: Police arrest serving officer, three civilians for alleged extortion, robbery in Benin . The police command in Edo has arrested a serving police officer and three civilians . They are accused of terrorising residents of Benin through acts of brutality, extortion, and armed robbery .

Title: Preview: Man United host Arsenal in EPL’s first big clash
Summary: The Premier League returns with its first heavyweight showdown on Sunday . Manchester United host Arsenal at Old Trafford in the EPL's first big clash .

Title: Adamawa by-election: APC wins Ganye Constituency
Summary: The All Progressives Congress (APC) in Adamawa has won the Ganye Constituency by-election into the State House of Assembly .

Title: Nigeria joins Africa in breakthrough malaria treatment for newborns
Summary: Nigeria has been named among eight African countries that contributed to a clinical trial leading to the approval of the first malaria treatment for newborns and infants weighing less than five kilograms .

Title: Yobe provides relief to flood victims
Summary: Heavy rainfall on Friday, which affected parts of Potiskum, Yobe State Government has swiftly activated emergency response measures through the State Emergency Management Agency . Yobe SEMA’s field response team is working closely with partners such as . the National Emergency . Management Agency Nigeria, IOM Nigeria, the International Committee of the Red Cross

Title: Iraq uncovers mass grave of IS victims
Summary: Official estimates put the number of bodies buried at the site at at least 4,000, with the possibility of thousands more . Victims buried there include “soldiers executed by IS,” members of the Yazidi minority, and residents of Mosul . Title: Police arrest officer, others for robbery in Benin
Summary: The Edo Police Command has nabbed a serving police officer and three other accomplices for allegedly terrorising residents of Benin through acts of brutality, extortion, and armed robbery . The arrest followed a viral video in which a victim allegedly accused some policemen of abducting him, seizing his phone and belongings, while subjecting him to harassment

Title: 2027: Politicians opposing Tinubu motivated by personal interests — APC chieftain
Summary: A chieftain of the All Progressives Congress in Akwa Ibom State, Otuekong John, has stated that politicians challenging President Bola Tinubu’s re-election bid in the 2027 presidential elections are driven more by personal vendetta than national interest . John, who is the Director General of the

Title: Corpse of missing Nigerian woman found in US
Summary: Olasinmibo Abosede, known as Sinmi, had been missing since July 30 . Her remains were found in the Springbrook Prairie Forest Preserve, Illinois, on Thursday . Police said the clothing on the deceased matched what she was last seen wearing .
